title: The Squirrel Who Planted a Button
author: Vikas Rana
summary: A forgetful squirrel named Squeaky accidentally plants a button and is amazed by what grows in its place.
content: Squeaky the squirrel was the best nut-finder in the whole park, but he was also the most forgetful.
One autumn afternoon, while burying his acorns, a shiny blue button fell from a passing coat.
Mistaking it for a strange, smooth acorn, Squeaky buried it with extra care. He forgot all about it until the spring.
When he returned to his secret spot, he found something amazing. A tall, twisty plant had grown right where he had buried the button.
On its leaves were dozens of smaller, shiny buttons of every color!
The other squirrels were amazed. They had never seen a button bush before.
Squeaky, puffing out his chest with pride, realized his mistake had turned into something beautiful and unique.
He decided that sometimes, the best treasures are the ones you do not expect.

The best magic was not in getting things, but in creating beauty and joy to share.

title: The Little Boat and the Big Ocean

summary: A small toy boat is scared of the big waves, but learns that courage means trying, even when you're afraid.
content: Barnaby was a little toy boat. He loved sailing in the bathtub, where the water was calm and warm.

Barnaby shivered. 'I can't go in there!' he whispered. 'The waves are too big and scary!'
Mia placed him gently in a small, quiet pool of water near the shore. A tiny crab scuttled by. 'The ocean is fun!' it clicked its claws. 'You just have to ride the waves!'
A small wave washed into the pool, lifting Barnaby up and down. It wasn't scary; it was like a gentle rock.
